question: Why do you want to become a doctor?
What qualities do you think make a good physician?
Tell me about yourself.
Why did you choose our medical school?
What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?
How do you handle stress?
What do you see as the biggest challenge facing healthcare today?
Where do you see yourself in 10 years?
What will you do if you are not accepted to medical school this year?
Describe your most meaningful clinical experience.
Tell me about a time you worked as part of a team.
Describe a time you had a conflict with a team member. How did you resolve it?
Tell me about a time you failed. What did you learn?
Describe a situation where you had to adapt to a significant change.
Give an example of a time you demonstrated leadership.
Tell me about a time you made a mistake. How did you handle it?
Describe a time you had to deliver bad news.
Tell me about a time you had to make a difficult ethical decision.
Describe a time you had to advocate for someone else.
Tell me about a time you had to manage multiple responsibilities.
A patient refuses a life-saving blood transfusion for religious reasons. What do you do?
You see a classmate cheating on an exam. What is your response?
A patient requests antibiotics for a viral infection. How do you handle this?
You are running late for a meeting and see someone collapse. What do you do?
A parent refuses to vaccinate their child. How do you approach this situation?
You are asked to break bad news to a patient. How would you approach this?
A colleague is impaired at work. What do you do?
You are given a task you feel unqualified for. How do you proceed?
A patient cannot afford their medication. What do you do?
You are asked to see more patients than you can safely handle. What do you do?
Describe a time you faced an ethical dilemma. How did you handle it?
Is it ever acceptable to lie to a patient?
How would you handle a situation where a patient wants to end their own life?
What would you do if you made a medical error?
How do you balance patient autonomy with beneficence?
Should physicians participate in capital punishment?
How do you feel about physician-assisted suicide?
Is it ethical to ration healthcare resources?
How would you handle a situation where a patient refuses treatment?
Should doctors be allowed to strike?
What appeals to you about our curriculum?
How will you contribute to our medical school community?
What do you hope to gain from our program?
What specialty are you interested in and why?
How do you plan to handle the academic rigor of medical school?
What do you know about our school’s mission and values?
How do you plan to get involved in research or extracurriculars here?
What do you think sets our program apart from others?
How will you handle living in this city/state?
What concerns do you have about starting medical school?
What is your opinion on the current state of healthcare in the US?
How has COVID-19 changed your perspective on medicine?
What are your thoughts on telemedicine?
How should healthcare address health disparities?
What role should doctors play in public health policy?
How do you feel about the use of AI in medicine?
What is your opinion on universal healthcare?
How should the medical community address physician burnout?
What is your view on vaccine hesitancy?
How should medicine adapt to an aging population?
Tell me about a time you had to advocate for a patient or cause.
Describe a time you had to work with someone very different from yourself.
Tell me about a time you had to make a quick decision.
Describe a time you had to deal with ambiguity.
Tell me about a time you had to learn something quickly.
Describe a time you had to deal with a difficult patient or customer.
Tell me about a time you had to manage a heavy workload.
Describe a time you had to work under pressure.
Tell me about a time you had to resolve a misunderstanding.
Describe a time you had to motivate others.
You are a medical student and see a resident mistreating a patient. What do you do?
A patient asks for your personal opinion on a controversial topic. How do you respond?
You are asked to work with a team member you dislike. How do you handle it?
A patient’s family is angry about their care. How do you respond?
You are asked to perform a procedure you have never done before. What do you do?
A patient confides in you about abuse. What is your responsibility?
You are running late and make a minor error. What do you do?
A patient is non-compliant with their treatment. How do you address this?
You are asked to cover for a colleague who is absent. How do you respond?
A patient requests a treatment you believe is unnecessary. What do you do?
Explain any gaps in your education or employment.
Have you ever had to overcome a significant obstacle? How did you do it?
Have you ever been disciplined academically or professionally?
What is your greatest weakness?
Describe a time you received critical feedback. How did you respond?
Have you ever failed a class or exam? What did you learn?
Have you ever been in a situation where you had to admit you were wrong?
Describe a time you struggled to meet a deadline.
Have you ever had to ask for help? What was the outcome?
Describe a time you had to deal with failure.
What do you like to do for fun?
Who has had the greatest influence on your life?
What book has had the biggest impact on you?
What is something most people don’t know about you?
What motivates you?
How do you handle disappointment?
What are you most proud of?
What is your biggest accomplishment?
What do you hope to achieve in your medical career?
If you could change one thing about healthcare, what would it be and why?
